name: English Learning Starters
desc: Our EL Fundamental courses start with English Language Starters where students are first introduced to the English alphabet & short vowel sounds, advancing through our Phonics course focused on long vowels & consonant blends, and completing in our Foundations course where students can confidently read & write simple sentences. Students engage in various learning activities, practice reading / listening / speaking / writing, refine their fine motor skills, and are exposed to social learning through designed interactions with their peers.

strings: Alphabet recognition and application
Short vowel sounds
Long vowel sounds
Consonant blends
Reading using digraphs
Basic reading & writing of 3~4 letter monosyllabic words
Fly Phonics 1 to 4: Phonic series that cover the alphabet & sounds, short & long vowels, and consonant blends & digraphs.

Reading Sketch Starters 1 to 3: To apply basic phonic knowledge to practical reading application, the Reading Sketch Starter series support fundamental phonics learning through visual stories and exciting themes.
Reading Sponge: Next in the NE Build & Grow series, this reading book supports advanced phonic learners and prepares our students to transition into the regular EL program.

name: English Learning 1-4
desc: Our EL 1 to 4 courses aim to develop the core language skills; Reading, Listening, Speaking, and Writing. Each level has been aligned to the US Common Core State Standards to provide rigorous standards and support advance English learning. Our experienced mentors deliver engaging lessons, as well as focus on student character building, in order to support holistic learning. This is focuses on the whole child as a young learner. Students maintain vocabulary journals, learn various academic skills, practice and produce from lesson objectives, and collaborate on projects.

strings: Improve reading comprehension to a US 5th grade equivalent
Recognize elements of a story
Know how to accurately summarize events, stories, and passages
Coherently express ideas in a structured and developed responnse
Strengthen language & writing skills

Subject Link 1 to 8: This series is used to support topic knowledge, themed/multi-disciplined learning, and improve reading comprehension. The themes are used to engage students, using their curiosity to learn specific vocabulary. The passages are used to practice reading skills and improve comprehension.

Spectrum Writing: The workbooks guide students as they write for a variety of purposes, including story-telling, personal narratives, descriptive writing, and opinion writing. This series also support current state standards, and take students through the full writing process; planning, drafting, revising, proofreading, and sharing writing.

Spectrum Language Arts: To reinforce written and spoken accuracy, the Spectrum Lannguage Arts series provides focused practice and creative activities. Students cover a variety of basic and advance language skills, such as; capitalization, punctuation, grammar, and parts of speech.

name: Engineering
desc: Engineering is an interdisciplinary branch which requires a practical approach in applying learned knowledge to real life situations. At Point Avenue, our Engineering program incorporates activities that are based on existing technologies and problems.  These activities will allow students to understand the connections between related areas in math and science.  Our program will introduce concepts from multiple fields of Engineering: Aerospace, Biomedical, Civil, Environmental, Chemical, Mechanical, Electrical, and Agricultural Engineering.  Students will be given the opportunity to learn and explore these fields with hands-on activities, games, and projects.

strings: Beginner: Develop a curiosity and a foundational interest for basic engineering concepts through empirical exploration
Intermediate: Develop confidence through theoretical and empirical learning of major engineering disciplines. Examine problems through an iterative mindset

name: Environmental Science
desc: Our EL Fundamental courses start with English Language Starters where students are first introduced to the English alphabet & short vowel sounds, advancing through our Phonics course focused on long vowels & consonant blends, and completing in our Foundations course where students can confidently read & write simple sentences. name: Coding
desc: Computer science skills are becoming more relevant in all aspects of society, and students with these skills, such as coding and basic robotics, are learning them at earlier ages. At Point Avenue, we’ve curated coding and robotics lessons for students ages 8-12, with EL3-4 level English proficiency, that are able to bring their own laptops or tablets to class. This course is great for the beginner to intermediate level coder.

strings: Understand the fundamentals of coding with a coding resource (e.g. Kamibot, the world’s first programmable paper robot).
Students will come to understand computer programming principles and also improve their focus, perseverance, and resilience.

Students will learn CoffeeScript, a programming language that is used in web applications and compiled to JavaScript. JavaScript is the industry standard for web applications, and one of the most highly sought after proficiencies for programming languages.
Students will also study Scratch, a block coding language developed by MIT.
They will apply these skills all while iterating: learning from their mistakes, and building their foundational knowledge to create something new.

name: ELA Foundations
desc: This course is the first level in our Middle School ELA curriculum. This course is designed for students who are learning the foundations and basic of English. This course focuses on English fundamentals and helps with fluency, grammar, spelling, and basic sentence structure. This course acts as a bridge to to the ELA beginner course. Pathways is National Geographic Learning's new five-level academic skills series that features reading & writing and listening & speaking strands to help learners develop the language skills needed to achieve academic success. Learners develop academic literacy skills through content, images and video from National Geographic. This innovative series provides learners with a pathway to success!
With Pathways learners:
Develop academic literacy skills
Connect to the real world through content from National Geographic
Achieve academic success

strings: Our ELA courses help students master the essential skills required for high school, college, career, and life in today’s global economy through adhering to United States Common Core Standards. Students advance through the four levels of ELA from Foundations to ELA Advanced. Students will be placed based on a diagnostic assessment which focuses on reading, writing, speaking, and listening proficiency.
The ELA standards align with college expectations in 6 domains
1) Language (conventions, knowledge, vocabulary)
2) Reading: Informational (ideas, details, structure, range, text complexity)
3) Reading: Literature (ideas, details, structure, range, text complexity)
4) Reading: Foundational (concepts, phonological awareness, recognition, fluency)
5) Speaking and Listening (comprehension, collaboration, presentation)
6) Writing (type, purpose, production, distribution, research, range of writing)
National Geographic Pathways Foundations
Reading & Writing / Speaking & Listening

Pathways is a global five-level academic English program. Carefully-guided lessons develop the language skills, critical thinking, and learning strategies required for academic success. Using authentic and relevant content from National Geographic, Pathways prepares students to work effectively and confidently in an academic environment.

name: ELA Beginner
desc: Designed for students who have a minimal foundation with English language fundamentals involving reading, writing, listening, and speaking. Students at this level can communicate in English at a low level of fluency, requiring constant corrections and prompting. The goal is to have students hold basic conversations without assistance. A heavy focus will be placed on appropriate grammatical conventions and vocabulary expansion. Pathways is National Geographic Learning's new five-level academic skills series that features reading & writing and listening & speaking strands to help learners develop the language skills needed to achieve academic success. Learners develop academic literacy skills through content, images and video from National Geographic. This innovative series provides learners with a pathway to success!
With Pathways learners:
Develop academic literacy skills

Achieve academic success

name: ELA Intermediate
desc: Designed for students who have a moderate grasp of English language fundamentals involving reading, writing, listening, and speaking. Students at this level can communicate in English with some fluency, requiring some corrections and prompting. The goal is to improve articulation, word choice, comprehension and speaking/written fluidity. Focus will be placed on appropriate grammatical conventions and vocabulary expansion. name: Pages (Reading Comprehension)
desc: In the age of information, it is crucial to understand how to draw meaning from what you read. Pages is a quest for enlightenment and captivation for students, as their personal capacity for critical and analytical thinking unveils. Young minds commit themselves to the vigorous reading and exploration of real-life and fictional literary texts to strengthen their comprehension level, reading speed, and interest in literature. Through stimulating questions and expertly led discussions, this course helps students conquer their fear of reading and become confident, competent book lovers. In addition to putting their language skills, self-expression and reasoning into action, students enhance their power to carefully listen to and consider the views of others. Towards the end of the journey, a more mindful young person emerges who is better able to articulate opinions based on textual references and with the confidence to be heard.

strings: 1) To improve Lexile measures (reading proficiency scores) by helping students:
-Identify the various elements of literature, including plot, theme, setting, mood, etc.
-Distinguish between text types by understanding how word choice, structure, and tone may vary according to the purpose and genre of literature.
-Develop critical and analytical thinking skills by deconstructing character development, cause-and-effect relationships, symbols, foreshadowing techniques, and author’s bias or perspective.
2) To increase reading speed by helping students:
-Improve reading speed by learning skimming and scanning techniques, and how to read with purpose.
-Improve reading comprehension by discovering specialized reading strategies to understand texts better, which will ultimately lead to increased reading speed.
3) To get students to read a minimum of 2 books in 12 weeks, along with helping them develop an interest in reading by:
-Practicing sustained silent reading, reading as a class, and facilitating discussions on what is read.

Students will be provided with acces to the Renaissance myON® Reader. A personalized digital library at every student's fingertips, Renaissance myON® Reader is a student-centered, personalized literacy environment that gives students access to more than 6,000 enhanced digital books. Titles are dynamically matched to each individual student's interests, grade and Lexile® reading level.

name: Ink (Academic and Creative Writing)
desc: Point Avenue’s Ink program is designed to develop and grow students academic and creative writing skills. The primary goal of the Ink course is to help students build foundational writing skills through western and contemporary teaching styles, and foster the important 21st century skills of creative and critical thinking. Academic and creative writing styles, two core components of this course, complement each other in exercising different thought processes and methods for conveying messages in written format. Students will focus on refining the communication of resources - both known and assumed fact (academic) as well as create original written content (creative). The course texts (National Georgraphic and Word Roots) serve as a resource and guide in order to facilitate proper writing fundamentals. This course will also strive to develop a love of writing for students through choosing interesting topics related to their interests and passions.

strings: 1) Develop the ability to write different paragraph forms
-Understand opinion writting, sequence writing, topic sentences, conclusing sentences
-Leardn how to write process, narrative, descriptive, and opinion papers
2) Improve grammar and overall sentence structure
-Students will use the software platform Quill to practice grammar and track their progress throughout the term.
-Use Focused Correction Areas (FCA's) to analyze improvement areas in their writing
3) Increase vocabulary and comprehension
-Understand and use appropriate prefixes, suffixes using the Word Roots curriculum
-Learn new words each week to incorporate in their writing
4) Develop a genuine interest in writing
-We aim to create a student centric environment promoting writing topics related to student interests and passions
National Geographic Great Writing Series

The Great Writing Series uses clear explanations and extensive practical activities to help students write great sentences, paragraphs, and essays. Each book contains a wide variety of writing models in carefully selected rhetorical styles that provide practice in working with the writing process to develop a final piece of writing.
Word Roots Book Series

These award-winning books teach the meaning and spelling of roots, prefixes, and suffixes that are the elements used to form words in English. Learning these word elements dramatically improves spelling and the ability to decode unfamiliar words.

name: Life Coaching Beginner/Intermediate
desc: The Life Coaching Beginner/Intermediate course focuses on aspects of growing up, developing good habits, and creating a growth mindset. In this course, students will use the book 7 Habits of Highly Effective teens to learn life skills that will make their transition into young adulthood easier and give them confidence, decisiveness, and the ability to critique themselves in order to constantly evolve and grow. Students will work on their overall confidence by practicing public speaking, doing weekly exercises, and engaging in leadership challenges. This course is a mixture of health and wellness, academic competency, and leadership principles. After completing this course, students will be able to enroll in the Life Coaching Advanced course. Life Coaching Advanced includes more complex leadership concepts and principles meant to further develop your child into a future leader.

strings: Course Structure:
-40% Exercise and wellness
-30% Academically focused
-30% Leadership focused
Course Objectives:
-Weekly Fitness (60 minutes each week)
-Develop soft skills (posture, eye contact, confidence)
-Understanding of foundational leadership principles
-Leadership speeches
-Daily journal writing
-Teamwork and teambuilding challenges
-Social and Emotional well-being
-Develop a growth mindset
-7 Habits of Highly Effective Teens Textbook and Workbook by Sean Covey

In the book, Covey discusses how teenagers can become more independent and effective by following seven basic habits. The habits range from being proactive in every aspect of one's life to planning and prioritizing one's daily life and responsibilities
-Point Avenue Daily Journal

For this course, each student is required to maintain a journal that we supply them. Inside they are to keep track of daily goals, notable events, lessons learned, and things they are grateful for. The purpose of these journals is to measure effort in making personal growth intentional, as well as to teach students daily self-reflection in order for them to improve and grow their perspectives.

name: Life Coaching Advanced
desc: The Life Coaching Advanced course focuses on aspects of self-awareness, mindfulness, and community service. In this course, students will learn about mindfulness skills and concepts through a step-by-step process, focusing on understanding themselves and others when making decisions and acquiring knowledge. This course establishes a foundation for critical thinking skills for students to build upon as they prepare for high school and beyond. Key example lessons include: focused awareness, sharpening the senses (mindful taste, touch, smell, sight), optimism, gratitude, and kindness. In addition to MindUp, students will plan a community service activity, exercise each week for 60 minutes, and complete a daily journal.

strings: Course Structure:
-45% Exercise and wellness
-30% Academically focused
-25% Leadership focused
Course Objectives:
-Weekly fitness (60-70 minutes each week)
-Develop soft skills (posture, eye contact, confidence)
-Social and Emotional Well being concepts
-Mindfulness Activities
-Daily Journal Writing (track progress)
-1 community service project plan and presentation
-MindUp Curriculum
MindUP gives children the knowledge and tools they need to manage stress, regulate emotions and face the challenges of the 21st century with optimism, resilience and compassion.
-Point Avenue Daily Journal

For this course, each student is required to maintain a journal that we supply them. Inside they are to keep track of daily goals, notable events, lessons learned, and things they are grateful for. The purpose of these journals is to measure effort in making personal growth intentional, as well as to teach students daily self-reflection in order for them to improve and grow their perspectives.
